decision_conditions: The development shall be carried out in accordance with the following amended conditionsCondition 4No development shall take place (including any works of demolition) until a construction management plan or construction method statement for the relevant phase of works has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan/statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period.i) How the proposed development will be built;ii) Hours of working (which shall be limited to 08.00 to 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 to 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays);iii) The procedure for loading/unloading materials;iv) The route to and away from site for muck away and vehicles with materials;v) The protocol for managing deliveries to one vehicle at a time on sites with restricted access orvi) space;vii) The protocol for managing vehicles that need to wait for access to the site;viii) Whether any reversing manoeuvres are required onto or off the public highway into the site and whether a banksman will be provided;ix) Temporary site access;x) Signing system for works traffic;xi) Whether site access warning signs will be required in adjacent roads;xii) Whether it is anticipated that statutory undertaker connections will be required into the site;xiii) The storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles;xiv) The potential for impacts from dust and emissions during the demolition and/or construction phase upon local air quality and surrounding residents;xv) Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arisingxvi) from development works;xvii) The location of all ancillary site buildings;xviii) The means of enclosure of the site, its erection and maintenance;xix) Wheel washing equipment;xx) The parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;xxi) Meeting the requirements of the Low Emission Zone for Non-Road Mobile Machinery (where relevant plant or vehicles are being used); andxxii) The method of recycling and disposing of waste resulting from the demolition and/or construction phasesDeliveries/collections to and from the site shall use a route that is agreed with the highway authority and the agreed route shall be signed accordingly.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012. This condition must be a pre-commencement condition in order to be effective.Condition 15 No later than 12 months after occupation of the development, a Post Construction Certificate verifying that at least BREEAM 'Very Good' level has been achieved unless otherwise agreed in writing beforehand, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energyCondition 25Prior to the commencement of any development, with the exception of site preparation and external demolition works, details and specifications of all external construction materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with the Metropolitan Police.The submitted scheme shall demonstrate how the construction materials comply with the latest CPNI guidance (or where sufficient clarity is not provided, in line with advice provided by a qualified Structural Blast Engineer (SBE) preferably from the register of Security Engineers and Specialists (RSES)).The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved scheme and retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To improve community safety and crime prevention in accordance with Policy CS 14 of Kingston Core Strategy: Safer Communities, Policy DM 22 Design for Safety and D11 Designing out Crime of the London Plan 2021.Condition 28In accordance with the indicative Live Music Space shown on approved drawing number 1905(0)102 Rev E, or any alternative area identified for the potential provisions of live music, appropriate services to facilitate the playing of live music shall be provided prior to the first commencement of the drinking establishment (Sui Generis) / drinking establishment with expanded food provision (Sui Generis) use hereby permitted.The provision of live music shall be encouraged within marketing materials for the first floor drinking establishment use to encourage tenants to identify a potential space for live music within their respective unit.Reason: In order to contribute towards the provision of sufficient and suitable replacement community facility space and to contribute to the Borough's night time economy, in line with policies E1, HC5, HC6 and S1 of the London Plan (2012), Policy DM24 of the RBK Core Strategy (2012) and Policy K6 of the Kingston AAP.
description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission 22/03694/FUL to amend the wording of Conditions 4, 15, 25 and 28.
